required_header.download_date: ClinicalTrials.gov processed this data on November 19, 2021
required_header.link_text: Link to the current ClinicalTrials.gov record.

clinical_study.brief_title: A Clinical Trail of Acupuncture and Herbs for Post-stroke Cogntive Impairment
clinical_study.official_title: A Clinical Trail of Acupuncture and Herbs for Post-stroke Cogntive Impairment

lead_sponsor.agency: The Third Affiliated hospital of Zhejiang Chinese Medical University

clinical_study.source: The Third Affiliated hospital of Zhejiang Chinese Medical University

brief_summary.textblock: The traditional Chinese medicine rehabilitation for the post-stroke cognitive impairment will be intervened, which can promote the recovery of post-stroke cognitive function patients, reduce the disability rate and improve the quality of life.

detailed_description.textblock: This study will collect inpatients from April 2020 to December 2022 who from the third affiliated hospital of Zhejiang university of traditional Chinese medicine, Jiaxing hospital of traditional Chinese medicine, Hangzhou hospital of traditional Chinese medicine.this study sets strict time window (stroke recovery, 30-180 days), use multi-center, large sample, randomized controlled study method and the objective recognition rehabilitation evaluation criteria and efficacy evaluation system to evaluate the clinical effect and analysis of health economics.

study_design_info.masking: Quadruple (Participant, Care Provider, Investigator, Outcomes Assessor)

primary_outcome.description: Montreal Cognitive Assessment(MOCA) will be used,this method focus on the sensitivity and specificity of the scale for the recognition of cognitive impairment are high, and it is evaluated from visual spatial/executive function, language function, image ability orientation and so on.

secondary_outcome.description: The scale has a total of 14 items, including two parts: one is the physical life self-care scale, with 6 items (going to the toilet, eating, dressing, grooming, walking and bathing); The second is the instrumental daily living ability scale, which consists of 8 items (telephone, shopping, meal preparation, housework, laundry, transportation, medication and self-care economy).
use Hamilton Depression Scale to evaluate depression，the score were 24 for severe, 17 for moderate and 7 for mild.

secondary_outcome.measure: Montreal cognitive assessment scale score change trend
secondary_outcome.time_frame: at baseline, 0 week, 8 weeks, 12 weeks, 16 weeks and 24 weeks
secondary_outcome.description: analyse the change scale scores of different stages(Before intervention；After 8 weeks 、16 weeks 、24 weeks intervention) MOCA, the higher scores mean a better outcome

secondary_outcome.measure: Changes in memory, attention and computational ability, language function
secondary_outcome.description: use MOCA to evaluate Memory, attention and calculation ability, language function

secondary_outcome.measure: The rate of change in the scores of mini-Mental State Examination (MMSE)
secondary_outcome.time_frame: at baseline, 0 week, 8 weeks, 12 weeks, 16 weeks and 24 weeks
secondary_outcome.description: analyse the change scale score of before intervention MMSE, higher scores mean a better outcome
The changes of the concentration of oxy-hemoglobin(HbO2), deoxy-hemoglobin (Hbb), cerebral blood flow (CBF) and cerebral blood volume of Functional near-infrared spectroscopy(fNIRS) will be analyzed

secondary_outcome.measure: Changes in the patterns of related brain regions in cognitive impairment
secondary_outcome.description: use re-fMRI data of ALLF，ReHo，FC to evaluate brain function

secondary_outcome.measure: Effective rate of cognitive function treatment
secondary_outcome.time_frame: at baseline, 0 week, 8 weeks, 12 weeks, 16 weeks and 24 weeks
secondary_outcome.description: MoCA score will be calculated from baseline to 12 weeks of treatment and effective rate of treatment will follow the specific criteria. Recovery: the score increased by ≥90% compared with the baseline; Significant effective: the score increased between 70% and 89% compared with the baseline. Effective: the score increased between 30% and 69% compared with the baseline. Ineffective: the score increased < 30% compared with the baseline

arm_group.description: basic treatment+ Cognitive rehabilitation training+Chinese traditional rehabilitation

intervention.description: Chinese traditional rehabilitation including acupuncture and herbs

overall_official.affiliation: The Third Affiliated hospital of Zhejiang Chinese Medical University

facility.name: The Third Affiliated Hospital of Zhejiang Chinese Medical University
Hangzhou hospital of traditional Chinese medicine
Jiaxing hospital of Chinese traditional medicine

responsible_party.investigator_affiliation: The Third Affiliated hospital of Zhejiang Chinese Medical University
